qas.question: What team did Art Schlichter play for?
Where did the Detroit Drive play their home games?
In what year did the Drive go to their first Arena Bowl?
Who owned the Detroit Drive in this period?
What team did the owner of the Detroit Drive buy that led him to sell the Drive?

context: One of the league's early success stories was the <a0_0>Detroit Drive<a0_0/>. A primary team for some of the AFL's most highly regarded players, including George LaFrance and Gary and Alvin Rettig, as well as being a second career chance for quarterback Art Schlichter, the Drive regularly played before sold out crowds at <a1_0>Joe Louis Arena<a1_0/>, and went to the ArenaBowl every year of their existence (<a2_0>1988<a2_0/>–1993). The AFL's first dynasty came to an end when their owner, <a3_0>Mike Ilitch<a3_0/> (who also owned Little Caesars Pizza and the Detroit Red Wings) bought the <a4_0>Detroit Tigers<a4_0/> baseball team and sold the AFL team.
